ACFrequency.Label: AC Frequency
ACFrequency.Comment: AC frequency is the number of cycles per second in an alternating current (AC) sine wave.

Ability.Label: Ability
Ability.Comment: Possession of the means or skill to do something (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Mental Ability
subClass.Comment: The mental ability of an individual to remain focused on an external stimuli or an internal experience for a certain period of time (World Health Organisation).

subClass.Label: Mobility Ability
subClass.Comment: This ability is used to represent all kinetic abilities a person may have.

subClass.Label: Sensor Ability
subClass.Comment: Sensory ability is referred to the brain's ability to receive, interpret, and effectively use the information provided by the senses in human beings such as touch, hear, smell, vision, etc.

subClass.Label: Spatial Ability
subClass.Comment: This ability expresses the capacity to understand, reason and remember the spatial relations among objects and spaces.

ActiveFireProtectionDevice.Label: Active Fire Protection Device
ActiveFireProtectionDevice.Comment: It is an integral part of the fire protection used as a first response to minimize the spread of fire and related effects.

subClass.Label: Fire Extinguisher
subClass.Comment: An active fire protection instrument used by persons to blow out small scale fire.

Activity.Label: Activity
Activity.Comment: A process that a person, group of persons, or machine does during a specific amount of time, such as visiting, shopping, etc.

subClass.Label: Emergency Activity
subClass.Comment: An activity that is done with an urgency and highest priority.

subClass.Label: Navigation
subClass.Comment: The process or activity of accurately ascertaining one's position and planning and following a route (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Visit
subClass.Comment: An activity that represents an act of going to see a person or place as a guest, tourist or a spectator. Normally, this type of activity is considered as a leasiure or recreational activity.

ActivityImpact.Label: Activity Impact
ActivityImpact.Comment: A parameter to express the impact of an activity on a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of any specific value or a type.

ActivitySeverity.Label: Activity Severity
ActivitySeverity.Comment: A parameter to express the severity of an activity for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of  potential severity levels.

ActivityStatus.Label: Activity Status
ActivityStatus.Comment: It expresses the status of a specific activity being performed by a person.

ActuatingFunction.Label: Actuating function
ActuatingFunction.Comment: A function that allows to transmit data to actuators, such as level settings (e.g., temperature) or binary switching (e.g., open/close, on/off)

subClass.Label: Level control function
subClass.Comment: An actuating function that allows to do level adjustments of an actuator in a certain range (e.g., 0%-100%), such as dimming a light or set the speed of an electric motor.

subClass.Label: On off function
subClass.Comment: An actuating function that allows to switch on and off an actuator

subClass.Label: Open close function
subClass.Comment: An actuating function that allows to open and close a device

subClass.Label: Start stop function
subClass.Comment: An actuating function that allows to start and stop a device

Actuator.Label: Actuator
Actuator.Comment: A device responsible for moving or controlling a mechanism or system by performing an actuating function

subClass.Label: Switch
subClass.Comment: A device of category saref:Actuator that performs an actuating function of type saref:OnOffFunction or saref:OpenCloseFunction

AirConditioner.Label: Air Conditioner
AirConditioner.Comment: A machine that keeps the air in a building cool.

AlarmProperty.Label: Alarm
AlarmProperty.Comment: A warning of danger or potential undesired situation.

AlertingDevice.Label: Alerting Device
AlertingDevice.Comment: Alerting devices are those devices that are used to react to normal as well as alarming situations to let people know that some specific condition is occuring.

subClass.Label: Alerting Device For Impaired Person
subClass.Comment: An alerting device that is used to assist or notify people with impairments during a specific circumstance.

AlertingDeviceForImpairedPerson.Label: Alerting Device For Impaired Person
AlertingDeviceForImpairedPerson.Comment: An alerting device that is used to assist or notify people with impairments during a specific circumstance.

AlzheimersDiseasedPerson.Label: Alzheimer's Diseased Person
AlzheimersDiseasedPerson.Comment: A person having an Alzheimer's disease.

Apartment.Label: Apartment
Apartment.Comment: A suite of rooms usually on one floor of an apartmentÂ house (Cambridge English Dictionary).

AppartmentBuilding.Label: Appartment Building
AppartmentBuilding.Comment: A set of one or more buildings that contain apartments in it.

subClass.Label: Dishwasher
subClass.Comment: A machine for washing dishes.

subClass.Label: Heating Device
subClass.Comment: A device that produces heat.

subClass.Label: IT
subClass.Comment: An appliance related to IT (Information Technology) such as computer, printer, etc.

subClass.Label: Lamp
subClass.Comment: A device for giving light, especially one that has a covering or is contained within something.

subClass.Label: Stove Oven
subClass.Comment: A piece of equipment that burns fuel or uses electricity in order to heat a place.

subClass.Label: TV
subClass.Comment: A device shaped like a box with a screen that receives electrical signals and changes them into moving images and sound, or the method or business of sending images and sound by electrical signals.

subClass.Label: Tumble Dryer
subClass.Comment: A machine that dries washed clothes by spinning them in hot air inside a rotating drum.

subClass.Label: Washing Machine
subClass.Comment: A home appliance for washing clothes and linens automatically.

Area.Label: Area
Area.Comment: Specifies the area of the building.

AssemblyPoint.Label: Assembly Point
AssemblyPoint.Comment: A place where people in an office, etc. should go if there is an emergency, for example, a fire (Cambridge English Dictionary) .

Assumption.Label: Assumption
Assumption.Comment: The assumption of the methematical model of KPI calculation

AudioDescription.Label: Audio Description
AudioDescription.Comment: A type of description in which sounds such as voices, are used to provide the information about any entity.

AutonomousMobilityPerson.Label: Autonomous Mobility Person
AutonomousMobilityPerson.Comment: A person who can walk on his/her with a help of a non-motorised device, e.g. crutches.

AvailabilityStatus.Label: Availability Status
AvailabilityStatus.Comment: It expresses the status of something that is either available or not.

Battery.Label: Battery
Battery.Comment: The set of batteries that stores energy.

BlindPerson.Label: Blind Person
BlindPerson.Comment: A person who has lost the vision completly and can neither see naturally nor with the help of any device.

Boiler.Label: Boiler
Boiler.Comment: A device that heats water, especially to provide heating and hot water in a house.

BuildingElement.Label: BuildingElement
BuildingElement.Comment: The element composes the building structure.

subClass.Label: BuildingStorey
subClass.Comment: Building storey captures the storey structure in building

subClass.Label: ExteriorWall
subClass.Comment: The exterior wall that contributes thermal load to the building and zone

subClass.Label: ExteriorWindow
subClass.Comment: The exterior window that contributes thermal load to the building and zone

subClass.Label: Floor
subClass.Comment: The floor of the zone

subClass.Label: Roof
subClass.Comment: The roof of the zone

subClass.Label: Room
subClass.Comment: The room contained in the zone

subClass.Label: Zone
subClass.Comment: The thermal zone in the building

BuildingEntrance.Label: Building Entrance
BuildingEntrance.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a building.

subClass.Label: Duct
subClass.Comment: The duct in HVAC system

subClass.Label: Fan
subClass.Comment: The fan in HVAC system

subClass.Label: Pipe
subClass.Comment: The pipe in HVAC system, DHW system, etc.

subClass.Label: Pump
subClass.Comment: The pump in HVAC system, DHW system, etc.

subClass.Label: Shade
subClass.Comment: The shade of building envelope

BuildingExit.Label: Building Exit
BuildingExit.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a building.

BuildingParameter.Label: BuildingParameter
BuildingParameter.Comment: The building static parameter that to be measured, like area, volume, material property

subClass.Label: U-value
subClass.Comment: Overall thermal conductance of the envelope

subClass.Label: Volume
subClass.Comment: Specifies the volume of the air conditioned space in building

BuildingRelated.Label: Building
BuildingRelated.Comment: A category that includes devices as described by building related data models, such as IFC and FIEMSER

subClass.Label: Room
subClass.Comment: A room in a building. This class may be used to group devices.

subClass.Label: Tenant
subClass.Comment: A class that describes information about a tenant in a building.

BuildingStorey.Label: BuildingStorey
BuildingStorey.Comment: Building storey captures the storey structure in building

BuildingThing.Label: BuildingThing
BuildingThing.Comment: All things (here physical objects) that creates a building, it is intended as root of all building components.

subClass.Label: EnergyFacility
subClass.Comment: The energy facility in building that consumes or produces energy

BuildingType.Label: BuildingType
BuildingType.Comment: Building type describes the functinonal type of a building

ChemicalSpill.Label: Chemical Spill
ChemicalSpill.Comment: A hazardous event that happens due to the spillage or leakge of any toxic chemical in the building.

CinemaBuilding.Label: Cinema Building
CinemaBuilding.Comment: A building in which movies are shown.

Classroom.Label: Classroom
Classroom.Comment: A room, typically in a school, in which a class of students is taught (Oxford Dictionary of English).

CloseState.Label: Close state
CloseState.Comment: The state of a device that is CLOSE

ColourBlindPerson.Label: Colour Blind Person
ColourBlindPerson.Comment: A person having the decreased ability to see color or differences in color.

Command.Label: Command
Command.Comment: A directive that a device must support to perform a certain function. A command may act upon a state, but does not necessarily act upon a state. For example, the ON command acts upon the ON/OFF state, but the GET command does not act upon any state, it simply gives a directive to retrieve a certain value. We propose here a list of commands that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

subClass.Label: Get command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Notify command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Off command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: On command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Open command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Pause command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Set level command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Start command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Step down command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Step up command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Stop command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Toggle command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

Commodity.Label: Commodity
Commodity.Comment: A marketable item for which there is demand, but which is supplied without qualitative differentiation across a market. SAREF refers to energy commodities such as electricity, gas, coal and oil.

subClass.Label: Electricity
subClass.Comment: A type of commodity

subClass.Label: Gas
subClass.Comment: A type of commodity

subClass.Label: Water
subClass.Comment: A type of commodity

CommonArea.Label: Common Area
CommonArea.Comment: Amenities such as corridors, hallways, lobby, pool, toilets provided for the comfort and use of all occupants, owners, tenants, or users of a building or building complex.

Congestion.Label: Congestion
Congestion.Comment: An event that happens at bottlenecks when the flow of people increases than a provided limit due to herding (and similar phenomena of human behaviour), especially during an emergency evacuation process.

CorridorEntrance.Label: Corridor Entrance
CorridorEntrance.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a corridor.

CorridorExit.Label: Corridor Exit
CorridorExit.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a corridor.

CorridorSegment.Label: Corridor Segment
CorridorSegment.Comment: A fragment or an atomic element of a corridor.

Currency.Label: Currency unit
Currency.Comment: The unit of measure for price

Current.Label: Current
Current.Comment: The movement of electricity in a particular direction.

DHWSystem.Label: DHWSystem
DHWSystem.Comment: The domestic hot water system that provides hot water to the building

DatumSource.Label: DatumSource
DatumSource.Comment: Datum source needed for KPI calculation

DayCare.Label: Day Care
DayCare.Comment: A place where infants and young children are provided a supervision and care of during the daytime, particularly so that their parents can hold jobs.

DayType.Label: Day Type
DayType.Comment: Represents the type of weather for a given location (e.g. sunny, cloudy,...).

Description.Label: Description
Description.Comment: A representation and detail of a person, object, or event. It is used to describe the details of anything.

subClass.Label: Image Description
subClass.Comment: A type of description in which images are given to provide information about any entity.

subClass.Label: Textual Description
subClass.Comment: A type of description in which only text or writings are used to provide the information about any entity.

DeviationState.Label: Deviation State
DeviationState.Comment: It models the user's deviation state from one's proposed route. For example, NoDeviate, RareDeviate, OftenDeviate, and TooOftenDeviate.

Device.Label: Device
Device.Comment: A thing made or adapted for a particular purpose, especially a piece of mechanical or electronic equipment (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Display Screen
subClass.Comment: A display screen is an output device to represent the information in visual or tactile form.

subClass.Label: Gateway
subClass.Comment: A gateway is a piece of networking hardware used in telecommunications for telecommunications networks that allows data to flow from one discrete network to another.

subClass.Label: Grid related
subClass.Comment: A category that considers devices based on energy consumption information and profiles to optimize energy efficiency.

subClass.Label: Handheld Device
subClass.Comment: A smart device or a computer that is small enough to be used while holding it in the hands.

subClass.Label: Incident Protection Device
subClass.Comment: Device that is used to avoid and minimize the effects of potentially danger events for the occupants of the building as well as for the structure of building itself.

subClass.Label: Movable Device
subClass.Comment: A device that can be moved from one place to another place, e.g., mobile phone, computer trolley, etc.

subClass.Label: Sensor
subClass.Comment: Device, agent (including humans), or software (simulation) involved in, or implementing, a Procedure. Sensors respond to a stimulus, e.g., a change in the environment, or input data composed from the results of prior Observations, and generate a Result. Sensors can be hosted by Platforms.

subClass.Label: Telephone
subClass.Comment: A device for transmitting voices over a distance using wire or radio, by converting acoustic vibrations to electrical signals (Oxford Dictionary of English).

DisplayScreen.Label: Display Screen
DisplayScreen.Comment: A display screen is an output device to represent the information in visual or tactile form.

Distance.Label: Distance
Distance.Comment: The Distance between two points, nodes or spaces.

DistributedEnergyResource.Label: DistributedEnergyResources
DistributedEnergyResource.Comment: Distributed energy resource is the site energy resource in district like CHP (Combined Heat and Power), photovoltaic generation plant, etc.

District.Label: District
District.Comment: District is the platform where contains multi buildings and other physical objects.

DomesticColdWaterConsumption.Label: Domestic Cold Water Consumption
DomesticColdWaterConsumption.Comment: The amount of domestic cold water consumed.

DomesticHotWaterConsumption.Label: Domestic Hot Water Consumption
DomesticHotWaterConsumption.Comment: The amount of domestic hot water consumed.

DoorSwitch.Label: Door switch
DoorSwitch.Comment: A device of category saref:Actuator that consists of a switch, accomplishes the task saref:Safety, performs the saref:OpenCloseFunction, is used for controlling a door, and can be found in the state saref:OpenCloseState.

Dwelling.Label: Dwelling
Dwelling.Comment: Place where a person or group of people live.

Earthquake.Label: Earthquake
Earthquake.Comment: A sudden violent shaking of the ground, typically causing great destruction, as a result of movements within the earth's crust or volcanic action (Oxford Dictionary of English). It may cause a sudden panic among the occupants of the building.

ElectricConsumption.Label: Power Consumption
ElectricConsumption.Comment: The rate, per unit time, at which energy is consumed.

EmergencyActivity.Label: Emergency Activity
EmergencyActivity.Comment: An activity that is done with an urgency and highest priority.

subClass.Label: Emergency Evacuation
subClass.Comment: It represents an immediate escape of people away from a particular area that has ongoing or imminent hazard to their lives or property.

EmergencyEvacuation.Label: Emergency Evacuation
EmergencyEvacuation.Comment: It represents an immediate escape of people away from a particular area that has ongoing or imminent hazard to their lives or property.

EmergencyEvacuationGroup.Label: Emergency Evacuation Group
EmergencyEvacuationGroup.Comment: A group of two or more persons who are supposed to evacuate the building together.

EmergencyEvacuationRoute.Label: Emergency Evacuation Route
EmergencyEvacuationRoute.Comment: A type of route in which only those spaces are mentioned that are potentially safe for its users as well as the ending point of it must be an exit from a particular space.

EmergencyExit.Label: Emergency Exit
EmergencyExit.Comment: Emergency exit is logical point that is only used in case of any emergency conditions such as fire, etc.

EndPoint.Label: End Point
EndPoint.Comment: A logic point that is used to indicate the end of a corridor.

subClass.Label: Energy Consumption
subClass.Comment: The amount of energy consumed.

EnergyCost.Label: EnergyCost
EnergyCost.Comment: The cost for purchasing energy from external grid

EnergyCostTariff.Label: EnergyCostTariff
EnergyCostTariff.Comment: The tariff for purchasing energy per unit from main grid (district energy provider)

EnergyDemand.Label: EnergyDemand
EnergyDemand.Comment: The energy demand in district or buildings

EnergyFacility.Label: EnergyFacility
EnergyFacility.Comment: The energy facility in building that consumes or produces energy

EnergyForecast.Label: EnergyForecast
EnergyForecast.Comment: The forecast of energy demand or production

EnergyGain.Label: EnergyGain
EnergyGain.Comment: The energy gain is the produced energy that feed into external grid so as to obtain monetary gain

EnergyMeter.Label: Energy meter
EnergyMeter.Comment: An energy meter is a device of category saref:Meter that consists of a meter, accomplishes the tasks saref:MeterReading and saref:EnergyEfficiency, performs the saref:MeteringFunction and is used for the purpose of measuring the saref:Energy property

EnergyParameter.Label: EnergyParameter
EnergyParameter.Comment: Energy parameter describes energy behavior in district and buildings, inluding energy production, energy storage, energy supply, energy demand, energy cost and tariff, etc.

subClass.Label: EnergyProduction
subClass.Comment: Energy producted by generation system

subClass.Label: EnergyStorage
subClass.Comment: The energy stored by storage system

subClass.Label: EnergySupply
subClass.Comment: The energy supplied to end uses

subClass.Label: EnergyTariff
subClass.Comment: Tariff that is charged per energy unit by district energy providers

EnergyRelated.Label: Grid related
EnergyRelated.Comment: A category that considers devices based on energy consumption information and profiles to optimize energy efficiency.

subClass.Label: Load
subClass.Comment: A type of energy-related device that consumes energy

subClass.Label: Meter
subClass.Comment: A device built to accurately detect and display a quantity in a form readable by a human being. Further, a device of category saref:Meter that performs a saref:MeteringFunction.

subClass.Label: Micro renewable
subClass.Comment: A device that generates renewable energy from natural resources such as teh sun, wind and water

subClass.Label: Storage
subClass.Comment: A type of energy-related device that stores energy

EnergyStorage.Label: EnergyStorage
EnergyStorage.Comment: The energy stored by storage system

EnergySupply.Label: EnergySupply
EnergySupply.Comment: The energy supplied to end uses

subClass.Label: EnergySupplyFromEnergyProvider
subClass.Comment: The energy supplied by district energy provider for end uses

subClass.Label: EnergySupplyFromSiteProduction
subClass.Comment: The energy supplied directly by site production for end uses

subClass.Label: EnergySupplyFromStorage
subClass.Comment: The energy supplied by storage system for end uses

EnergySupplyFromExternalGrid.Label: EnergySupplyFromEnergyProvider
EnergySupplyFromExternalGrid.Comment: The energy supplied by district energy provider for end uses

EnergySupplyFromSiteProduction.Label: EnergySupplyFromSiteProduction
EnergySupplyFromSiteProduction.Comment: The energy supplied directly by site production for end uses

EnergySupplyFromStorage.Label: EnergySupplyFromStorage
EnergySupplyFromStorage.Comment: The energy supplied by storage system for end uses

EnergyTariff.Label: EnergyTariff
EnergyTariff.Comment: Tariff that is charged per energy unit by district energy providers

subClass.Label: FeedInTariff
subClass.Comment: The tariff for sale energy per unit to main grid

EnergyType.Label: EnergyType
EnergyType.Comment: The energy type produced, consumed, stored or provided, such as electricity, heat and cold

EnergyUnit.Label: Energy unit
EnergyUnit.Comment: The unit of measure for energy

EntityType.Label: EntityType
EntityType.Comment: Entity type describes the type of a entity like building, equipment, energy, etc.

subClass.Label: EquipmentType
subClass.Comment: Equipment type describes the type of an equipment

subClass.Label: PhotovoltaicType
subClass.Comment: Photovoltaic type describes the type of PV generating unit

Entrance.Label: Entrance
Entrance.Comment: Entrance represents a space or a door that is used to enter into a building. Normally, it is also used as an exit.

subClass.Label: Floor Entrance
subClass.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a floor.

subClass.Label: Hall Entrance
subClass.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a hall.

subClass.Label: Open Area Entrance
subClass.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to an open area.

subClass.Label: Room Entrance
subClass.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a room.

EnvironmentalParameter.Label: EnvironmentalParameter
EnvironmentalParameter.Comment: The parameter describes the environment condition, including indoor environment (indoor comfort) and outdoor environment (weather)

subClass.Label: IndoorComfort
subClass.Comment: Indoor comfort describes the indoor environment

subClass.Label: Weather
subClass.Comment: Weather describes the outdoor environment

subClass.Label: WeatherForecast
subClass.Comment: The short-term forecast of the weather

Equation.Label: Equation
Equation.Comment: The equation of the mathematical model for KPI calculation

Equipment.Label: Equipment
Equipment.Comment: The equipment in building and district power system.

EquipmentContainer.Label: EquipmentContainer
EquipmentContainer.Comment: Equipment container is the district power unit that contains groups of equipment, like substation, plant, Distributed Energy Resources, etc.

subClass.Label: Substation
subClass.Comment: Substation is where transform the high/medio voltage power from main grid to low voltage for the energy use of district consumers.

EquipmentParameter.Label: EquipmentParameter
EquipmentParameter.Comment: The parameters of power equipment or building equipment.

EquipmentType.Label: EquipmentType
EquipmentType.Comment: Equipment type describes the type of an equipment

Escalator.Label: Escalator
Escalator.Comment: A moving staircase consisting of an endlessly circulating belt of steps driven by a motor, which conveys people between the floors of a public building (Oxford Dictionary of English).

EscortSupportedWheelchairPerson.Label: Escort Supported Wheelchair Person
EscortSupportedWheelchairPerson.Comment: A physical impaired person whose wheelchair is escorted by another person.

Event.Label: Event
Event.Comment: An occurrence; something that happens (Oxford Dictionary of English). It represents when something planned or sudden happens.

subClass.Label: Incident
subClass.Comment: An event or occurance that can be dangerous for the occupants of the building.

subClass.Label: Sensor Event
subClass.Comment: This concept is used to express an event detected by any sensor.

EventFunction.Label: Event function
EventFunction.Comment: A function that allows to notify another device that a certain threshold value has been exceeded.

EventImpact.Label: Event Impact
EventImpact.Comment: A parameter to express the impact of an event on a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of any specific value or a type.

EventSeverity.Label: Event Severity
EventSeverity.Comment: A parameter to express the severity of an event for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of  potential severity levels.

Exit.Label: Exit
Exit.Comment: Exit represents a logical representation for escaping or releasing from a specific phsyical space. Generally, an exit is as same as an entrance.

subClass.Label: Floor Exit
subClass.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a specific floor and that leads to different floors of a building.

subClass.Label: Hall Exit
subClass.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a Hall.

subClass.Label: Open Area Exit
subClass.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit from a specifc open space.

subClass.Label: Room Exit
subClass.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a room.

ExitRoute.Label: Exit Route
ExitRoute.Comment: A type of route in which the ending point represents the exit of a specific space.

ExtWall.Label: ExteriorWall
ExtWall.Comment: The exterior wall that contributes thermal load to the building and zone

ExtWindow.Label: ExteriorWindow
ExtWindow.Comment: The exterior window that contributes thermal load to the building and zone

Family.Label: Family
Family.Comment: A group of two or more persons having family ties between them.

FeatureOfInterest.Label: FeatureOfInterest
FeatureOfInterest.Comment: A feature is an abstraction of real world phenomena (thing, person, event, etc)

FeedInTariff.Label: FeedInTariff
FeedInTariff.Comment: The tariff for sale energy per unit to main grid

Fire.Label: Fire
Fire.Comment: An event that may burn different parts of the building and hazourdous for both the people and the building.

FireDoor.Label: Fire Door
FireDoor.Comment: A type of door used to minimize the spread of fire and related effects by isolating two connected spaces or sections in the building.

FireEscapeLadder.Label: Fire Escape Ladder
FireEscapeLadder.Comment: A type of ladder which is used to make an emergency exit through the window out of fire accident site.

FireExtinguisher.Label: Fire Extinguisher
FireExtinguisher.Comment: An active fire protection instrument used by persons to blow out small scale fire.

FireProtectionDevice.Label: Fire Protection Device
FireProtectionDevice.Comment: Device that is used to minimize the effects of potentially danger fires.

subClass.Label: Passive Fire Protection
subClass.Comment: It is an integral component installed in the building while construction to resist the fire.

FitnessStatus.Label: Fitness Status
FitnessStatus.Comment: A fitness status is associated with a person that represent the quality of being suitable for a specific activity.

FloorEntrance.Label: Floor Entrance
FloorEntrance.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a floor.

FloorExit.Label: Floor Exit
FloorExit.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a specific floor and that leads to different floors of a building.

Footpath.Label: Footpath
Footpath.Comment: A path for pedestrians in a built-up area; a pavement.

Function.Label: Function
Function.Comment: The functionality necessary to accomplish the task for which a Device is designed. A device can be designed to perform more than one function. Functions can be structured in categories (subclasses) that reflect different points of view, for example, considering the specific application area for which a function can be used (e.g., light, temperature, motion, heat, power, etc.), or the capability that a function can support (e.g., receive, reply, notify, etc.), and so forth.

subClass.Label: Metering function
subClass.Comment: A function that allows to get data from a meter, such as current meter reading or instantaneous demand

subClass.Label: Sensing function
subClass.Comment: A function that allows to transmit data from sensors, such as measurement values (e.g., temperature) or sensing data (e.g., occupancy)

Gateway.Label: Gateway
Gateway.Comment: A gateway is a piece of networking hardware used in telecommunications for telecommunications networks that allows data to flow from one discrete network to another.

Generator.Label: Generator
Generator.Comment: A type of energy-related device that generates energy

subClass.Label: Photovoltaic System
subClass.Comment: A power system designed to supply usable solar power by means of photovoltaics.

subClass.Label: Thermo Solar System
subClass.Comment: A power system designed to supply thermal energy by means of solar energy.

subClass.Label: Get current meter value command
subClass.Comment: A type of get command

subClass.Label: Get meter data command
subClass.Comment: A type of get command

subClass.Label: Get meter history command
subClass.Comment: A type of get command

subClass.Label: Get sensing data command
subClass.Comment: A type of get command

GlobalHorizontalSolarIrradiance.Label: GlobalHorizontalSolar
GlobalHorizontalSolarIrradiance.Comment: The intensity of global solar radiation in horizontal level

GlobalInclined41SolarIrradiance.Label: GlobalInclined41Solar
GlobalInclined41SolarIrradiance.Comment: The intensity of global solar radiation in angel of 41 degree, the best angel in Madrid

GraphBasedRoute.Label: Graph-Based Route
GraphBasedRoute.Comment: A graph-based route is a graphical way of representing a route in terms of nodes (sometimes called vertices) and edges (sometimes called arcs).

Group.Label: Group
Group.Comment: It represents a collection of two or more people who interact with each other and may have the similar characteristics or objectives.

subClass.Label: Visiting Group
subClass.Comment: A group of two or more people that has the same objective of visiting any space.

HVACSystem.Label: HVACSystem
HVACSystem.Comment: The Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) system that provides building indoor comfort

HallEntrance.Label: Hall Entrance
HallEntrance.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a hall.

HallExit.Label: Hall Exit
HallExit.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a Hall.

HallSegment.Label: Hall Segment
HallSegment.Comment: A fragment or an atomic element of a hall.

HandheldDevice.Label: Handheld Device
HandheldDevice.Comment: A smart device or a computer that is small enough to be used while holding it in the hands.

subClass.Label: Mobile Phone
subClass.Comment: A telephone with access to a cellular radio system so it can be used over a wide area, without a physical connection to a network (Oxford Dictionary of English).

HearingImpairedPerson.Label: Hearing Impaired Person
HearingImpairedPerson.Comment: It is a partial or total unability to hear. It is also known as Hearing loss.

subClass.Label: Mild Hearing Impaired Person
subClass.Comment: A person who is only able to hear the sounds that are between 25 and 40 dB.

subClass.Label: Moderate Hearing Impaired Person
subClass.Comment: A person who cannot hear sounds that are less than 40-75 dB.

subClass.Label: Profound Hearing Impaired Person
subClass.Comment: A person who cannot hear sounds softer than 90-120 dB. A person suffering from profound hearing loss, using a hearing aid is also ineffective most of the time.

subClass.Label: Severe Hearing Impaired Person
subClass.Comment: A person who is unable to hear anything without wearing a hearing aid.

HeatPump.Label: Heat Pump
HeatPump.Comment: A heat pump is a device that transfers heat energy from a source of heat to what is called a heat sink.

HorizontalMovingPavement.Label: Horizontal Moving Pavement
HorizontalMovingPavement.Comment: A slow-moving conveyor mechanism that transports people across a horizontal plane over a short to medium distance.

HorizontalPassage.Label: Horizontal Passage
HorizontalPassage.Comment: A type of a passage that connects spatial elements located on the same storey or floor.

subClass.Label: Point Of Interest Segement
subClass.Comment: A traverasal part of a space that is connected to a specific Point of Interest.

subClass.Label: Road
subClass.Comment: A road is a way on land between two places that has been paved or otherwise improved to allow travel by foot or some form of conveyance, including a motor vehicle, cart, bicycle, or horse.

subClass.Label: Room Segment
subClass.Comment: A traversable part in a room that is usually used to go the exit or the other part of the room.

HotelBuilding.Label: Hotel Building
HotelBuilding.Comment: A building that contains rooms, apartments or suites where people stay for a specific time period.

IT.Label: IT
IT.Comment: An appliance related to IT (Information Technology) such as computer, printer, etc.

subClass.Label: Laptop
subClass.Comment: A computer that is portable and suitable for use while travelling.

subClass.Label: Printer
subClass.Comment: A machine that is connected to a computer and prints onto paper using ink.

Icon.Label: Icon
Icon.Comment: A small picture or symbol that represents a resource.

ImageDescription.Label: Image Description
ImageDescription.Comment: A type of description in which images are given to provide information about any entity.

Impact.Label: Impact
Impact.Comment: An impact is a long-lasting effect of an event (or activity), that continues to exist after the event (or activity) has taken place.

ImpairedPerson.Label: Impaired Person
ImpairedPerson.Comment: An individual whose natural senses or physical abilities are either diminished or damaged.

subClass.Label: Mental Impaired Person
subClass.Comment: A person having mental impairment in which one's mind is damaged or is not working properly and one have issues such as consciousness, orientation, concentration.

subClass.Label: Physically Impaired Person
subClass.Comment: A physical impairment is a condition in which any part of person's body is either  damaged or is not working properly.

subClass.Label: Sensory Impairmed Person
subClass.Comment: Sensory impairment is when one of the senses such as sight, hearing, smell, touch, taste and spatial awareness, is no longer normal.

Incident.Label: Incident
Incident.Comment: An event or occurance that can be dangerous for the occupants of the building.

subClass.Label: Panic
subClass.Comment: A  sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety among the occupants of the building that often causes wildly unthinking behaviour (Oxford Dictionary of English). In indoor environments, it may happens due to several reasons such as earthquake, fire or other sudden hazardous situations.

subClass.Label: Terrorist Attack
subClass.Comment: A surprise event involving the deliberate use of violence against the occupants of the buildings.

IncidentProtectionDevice.Label: Incident Protection Device
IncidentProtectionDevice.Comment: Device that is used to avoid and minimize the effects of potentially danger events for the occupants of the building as well as for the structure of building itself.

IndoorAirQuality.Label: IndoorAirQuality
IndoorAirQuality.Comment: Indoor air quality describes the quality (or contamination level) of indoor air

IndoorComfort.Label: IndoorComfort
IndoorComfort.Comment: Indoor comfort describes the indoor environment

subClass.Label: ThermalComfort
subClass.Comment: Thermal comfort describes the comfort condition related indoor temperature and humidity

subClass.Label: VisualComfort
subClass.Comment: The visual comfort describes the comfort related to light condition

Instant.Label: Instant
Instant.Comment: An instant is a time instant

Intensity.Label: Intensity
Intensity.Comment: The measurable amount of a property, such as force, brightness, or a magnetic field (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Interval.Label: Interval
Interval.Comment: The time interval of the observation or evaluation

Junction.Label: Junction
Junction.Comment: A logic point that connects more than two corridors.

KPI.Label: KeyPerformanceIndicator
KPI.Comment: Key Performance Indicator that measures the progress towards stakeholder's key performance goal

subClass.Label: OperationalKPI
subClass.Comment: The operational KPI is the KPI at the operational appliance level, the KPI corresponding to zone and equipment level.

subClass.Label: StrategicKPI
subClass.Comment: The strategic KPI is the KPI at the strategic decision level, the hyper-aggregated KPI corresponding to district scale

subClass.Label: TacticalKPI
subClass.Comment: The tactical KPI is the KPI at tactical decision level, the KPI disaggregated from strategic KPI corresponding to building and system level

KPICalculation.Label: KPICalculation
KPICalculation.Comment: The KPI calculation to calculate specific KPI with mathematical model and datum source

KPICalculationComponent.Label: KPICalculationComponent
KPICalculationComponent.Comment: The component needed for KPI calculation, like mathematical model, datum source, etc.

subClass.Label: Mathematical_model
subClass.Comment: The mathematical model for KPI calculation. The model is composed of a set of variables and a set of equations that establish relationships between the variables.

subClass.Label: UniversalConstant
subClass.Comment: The universal constant in the mathematical model of KPI calculation

subClass.Label: Variable
subClass.Comment: The variable in the mathematical model of KPI calculation

KPIEvaluatedObject.Label: KPIEvaluatedObject
KPIEvaluatedObject.Comment: The evaluated object of key performance indicator

KPIValue.Label: KPIValue
KPIValue.Comment: KPI value is the result of KPI calculation

KidsArea.Label: Kids Area
KidsArea.Comment: A place where infants or young children can play which is surrounded by a boundary normally. It can be both indoor and outdoor.

Lamp.Label: Lamp
Lamp.Comment: A device for giving light, especially one that has a covering or is contained within something.

Laptop.Label: Laptop
Laptop.Comment: A computer that is portable and suitable for use while travelling.

LevelControlFunction.Label: Level control function
LevelControlFunction.Comment: An actuating function that allows to do level adjustments of an actuator in a certain range (e.g., 0%-100%), such as dimming a light or set the speed of an electric motor.

Light.Label: Light
Light.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a illuminance unit (lux)

LightSwitch.Label: Light switch
LightSwitch.Comment: A device of category saref:Actuator that consists of a switch, accomplishes the task saref:Lighting, performs the saref:OnOffFunction, measures the property saref:Light, and can be found in the state saref:OnOffState. It can offer a switch on service.

LightingDevice.Label: Lighting device
LightingDevice.Comment: A device used for illumination, irradiation, signaling, or projection

LightingSystem.Label: LightingSystem
LightingSystem.Comment: The lighting system in the building

Load.Label: Load
Load.Comment: A type of energy-related device that consumes energy

subClass.Label: Washing machine
subClass.Comment: A device of category saref:Appliance and saref:Load that accomplishes the task saref:Washing, performs an actuating function of type saref:StartStopFunction, can be found in the state saref:StartStopState, and can have a saref:Profile that characterizes its energy consumption.

LowStaminaPerson.Label: Low Stamina Person
LowStaminaPerson.Comment: It is the unability to sustain physical or mental activity to a normal level.

LowVisionPerson.Label: Low Vision Person
LowVisionPerson.Comment: A person whose visual acuity is 20/70 or poorer in the better-seeing eye and cannot be corrected or improved with regular eyeglasses.

Measurement.Label: Measurement
Measurement.Comment: Represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.

subClass.Label: Power unit
subClass.Comment: The unit of measure for power

subClass.Label: Pressure unit
subClass.Comment: The unit of measure for pressure

subClass.Label: Temperature unit
subClass.Comment: The unit of measure for temperature

MeetingRoom.Label: Meeting Room
MeetingRoom.Comment: A type of room designated for social gathering of people, especially professional meetings.

MentalAbility.Label: Mental Ability
MentalAbility.Comment: The mental ability of an individual to remain focused on an external stimuli or an internal experience for a certain period of time (World Health Organisation).

MentalImpairedPerson.Label: Mental Impaired Person
MentalImpairedPerson.Comment: A person having mental impairment in which one's mind is damaged or is not working properly and one have issues such as consciousness, orientation, concentration.

Meter.Label: Meter
Meter.Comment: A device built to accurately detect and display a quantity in a form readable by a human being. Further, a device of category saref:Meter that performs a saref:MeteringFunction.

MeteringFunction.Label: Metering function
MeteringFunction.Comment: A function that allows to get data from a meter, such as current meter reading or instantaneous demand

MicroRenewable.Label: Micro renewable
MicroRenewable.Comment: A device that generates renewable energy from natural resources such as teh sun, wind and water

MildHearingImpairedPerson.Label: Mild Hearing Impaired Person
MildHearingImpairedPerson.Comment: A person who is only able to hear the sounds that are between 25 and 40 dB.

MobilePhone.Label: Mobile Phone
MobilePhone.Comment: A telephone with access to a cellular radio system so it can be used over a wide area, without a physical connection to a network (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Smartphone
subClass.Comment: A mobile phone that is able to perform many of the functions of a computer, typically having a relatively large screen and an operating system capable of running general-purpose applications (Oxford Dictionary of English).

MobilityAbility.Label: Mobility Ability
MobilityAbility.Comment: This ability is used to represent all kinetic abilities a person may have.

MobilityWithAssistedDevicePerson.Label: Mobility With Assisted Device Person
MobilityWithAssistedDevicePerson.Comment: A person who used a motorised device for moving, such as motorised wheelchair or scooter, etc.

subClass.Label: Motorised Wheelchair Person
subClass.Comment: It is a kind of wheelchair that has either a mechanical engine or an electric battery. It has more speed than a traditional wheelchair.

MobilityWithWheelchairPerson.Label: Mobility With Wheelchair Person
MobilityWithWheelchairPerson.Comment: A person using a wheelchair (a mobility device that is used while having any kind of tempoary or permanent physical impairment).

subClass.Label: Motorised Wheelchair Person
subClass.Comment: It is a kind of wheelchair that has either a mechanical engine or an electric battery. It has more speed than a traditional wheelchair.

subClass.Label: Non-Motorised Wheelchair Person
subClass.Comment: A traditional wheelchair that is used by hands. It has significantly lower speed than motorised wheelchairs.

ModerateHearingImpairedPerson.Label: Moderate Hearing Impaired Person
ModerateHearingImpairedPerson.Comment: A person who cannot hear sounds that are less than 40-75 dB.

Motion.Label: Motion
Motion.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a unit of measure for motion

MotionState.Label: Motion State
MotionState.Comment: It describes the movement of a person.

MotorImpairedPerson.Label: Motor Impaired Person
MotorImpairedPerson.Comment: A person who has either partial or total loss of function of a body part, usually a limb or limbs.

MotorisedWheelchairPerson.Label: Motorised Wheelchair Person
MotorisedWheelchairPerson.Comment: It is a kind of wheelchair that has either a mechanical engine or an electric battery. It has more speed than a traditional wheelchair.

MovableDevice.Label: Movable Device
MovableDevice.Comment: A device that can be moved from one place to another place, e.g., mobile phone, computer trolley, etc.

MovingPavement.Label: Moving Pavement
MovingPavement.Comment: A slow-moving conveyor mechanism that transports people across a horizontal or inclined plane over a short to medium distance (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Vertical Moving Pavement
subClass.Comment: A slow-moving conveyor mechanism that transports people across an inclined plane over a short to medium distance.

Navigation.Label: Navigation
Navigation.Comment: The process or activity of accurately ascertaining one's position and planning and following a route (Oxford Dictionary of English).

NavigationalPoint.Label: Navigational Point
NavigationalPoint.Comment: It is a special type of point that connects more than two corridors or enforce change of direction to users or indicate the end of corridors.

subClass.Label: Turn Point
subClass.Comment: A logic point that is used to enforce people to change their direction.

NavigationalState.Label: Navigational State
NavigationalState.Comment: It models the user's navigational state while following the path.

NetworkLinkStrength.Label: Network Link Strength
NetworkLinkStrength.Comment: The strength of a network link

Non-renewableGeneratingUnit.Label: Non-renewableGeneratingUnit
Non-renewableGeneratingUnit.Comment: The generating unit produces energy with non-renewable resources.

NonMotorisedWheelchairPerson.Label: Non-Motorised Wheelchair Person
NonMotorisedWheelchairPerson.Comment: A traditional wheelchair that is used by hands. It has significantly lower speed than motorised wheelchairs.

Observation.Label: Observation
Observation.Comment:
The observation data of the sensor or meter, the measurement of different parameter
An Observation is a Situation in which a Sensing method has been used to estimate or calculate a value of a Property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to Sensing and Sensor describe what made the Observation and how; links to Property and Feature detail what was sensed; the result is the output of a Sensor; other metadata details times etc.

ObservationValue.Label: ObservationValue
ObservationValue.Comment: The observation result of the sensor or meter

Occupancy.Label: Occupancy
Occupancy.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value (saref:hasValue property) that is measured in a unit of measure for occupancy

OccupancyParameter.Label: OccupancyParameter
OccupancyParameter.Comment: The parameter of occupancy like occupant number or other property

subClass.Label: OccupantNumber
subClass.Comment: The number of occupants in the zone or building

Occupant.Label: Occupant
Occupant.Comment: The occupant who occupies the zone in building

OccupantBehavior.Label: OccupantBehavior
OccupantBehavior.Comment: The behavior of occupant that influences to energy demand

OccupantNumber.Label: OccupantNumber
OccupantNumber.Comment: The number of occupants in the zone or building

OffState.Label: Off state
OffState.Comment: The state of a device that is ON

OnOffFunction.Label: On off function
OnOffFunction.Comment: An actuating function that allows to switch on and off an actuator

OnOffProperty.Label: On Off
OnOffProperty.Comment: A property that determines if something is activated (on) or not (off).

subClass.Label: On state
subClass.Comment: The state of a device that is OFF

OnState.Label: On state
OnState.Comment: The state of a device that is OFF

OpenAreaEntrance.Label: Open Area Entrance
OpenAreaEntrance.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to an open area.

OpenAreaExit.Label: Open Area Exit
OpenAreaExit.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit from a specifc open space.

OpenCloseFunction.Label: Open close function
OpenCloseFunction.Comment: An actuating function that allows to open and close a device

subClass.Label: Open state
subClass.Comment: The state of a device that is OPEN

OpenState.Label: Open state
OpenState.Comment: The state of a device that is OPEN

OperationalKPI.Label: OperationalKPI
OperationalKPI.Comment: The operational KPI is the KPI at the operational appliance level, the KPI corresponding to zone and equipment level.

OrderedList.Label: Ordered List
OrderedList.Comment: An ordered list with a given length an indexed items.

subClass.Label: Route
subClass.Comment: A set of connected spaces represented by a starting and ending point, that ultimately leads to some specific position or place.

PVSystem.Label: PVSystem
PVSystem.Comment: System that generates electricity through solar photovoltaic panel

Panic.Label: Panic
Panic.Comment: A  sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety among the occupants of the building that often causes wildly unthinking behaviour (Oxford Dictionary of English). In indoor environments, it may happens due to several reasons such as earthquake, fire or other sudden hazardous situations.

subClass.Label: Stampeding
subClass.Comment: A sudden and uncontrollable run by the group of people caused by panic.

Parameter.Label: Parameter
Parameter.Comment: A numerical or other measurable factor forming one of a set that defines a system or sets the conditions of its operation.

subClass.Label: Person Ability
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the quality of an ability a specific person (or type of persons) own.

subClass.Label: Person Accessibility
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the accessibility of any space for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of some value.

subClass.Label: Space Saftey
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the safety of any space for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of some value.

subClass.Label: Travel Time
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the time taken (in seconds) by a specific person (or type of persons) to go from one point to another point (i.e., Route Element).

Passage.Label: Passage
Passage.Comment: Any spatial element that is part of a path and traversable by persons. In addition, it may be used as a logic representation of physical passages to represent an edge (or an arc) in a route graph.

subClass.Label: Vertical Passage
subClass.Comment: A type of passage that connects spatial elements located on different storey or floor.

PassiveFireProtectionDevice.Label: Passive Fire Protection
PassiveFireProtectionDevice.Comment: It is an integral component installed in the building while construction to resist the fire.

PerformanceGoal.Label: PerformanceGoal
PerformanceGoal.Comment: The performance that needed to be achieved

PersonAbility.Label: Person Ability
PersonAbility.Comment: A parameter to express the quality of an ability a specific person (or type of persons) own.

PersonAccessibility.Label: Person Accessibility
PersonAccessibility.Comment: A parameter to express the accessibility of any space for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of some value.

PhotovoltaicGeneratingUnit.Label: PhotovoltaicGeneratingUnit
PhotovoltaicGeneratingUnit.Comment: The generating unit produces energy with solar energy, photovoltaic panels.

PhotovoltaicSystem.Label: Photovoltaic System
PhotovoltaicSystem.Comment: A power system designed to supply usable solar power by means of photovoltaics.

PhotovoltaicType.Label: PhotovoltaicType
PhotovoltaicType.Comment: Photovoltaic type describes the type of PV generating unit

PhysicalObject.Label: PhysicalObject
PhysicalObject.Comment: An inanimate, three-dimensional object or substance. The physical object identified in the district.

PhysicallyImpairedPerson.Label: Physically Impaired Person
PhysicallyImpairedPerson.Comment: A physical impairment is a condition in which any part of person's body is either  damaged or is not working properly.

Pipe.Label: Pipe
Pipe.Comment: The pipe in HVAC system, DHW system, etc.

Point.Label: GeographicalCoordinatesPoint
Point.Comment:
A point, typically described using a coordinate system relative to Earth, such as WGS84, includes the latitude, altitude and longitude of a place. Uniquely identified by lat/long/alt. i.e.

spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2) :- lat(P1, LAT), long(P1, LONG), alt(P1, ALT),
  lat(P2, LAT), long(P2, LONG), alt(P2, ALT).

sameThing(P1, P2) :- type(P1, Point), type(P2, Point), spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2).

PointOfInterest.Label: Point Of Interest
PointOfInterest.Comment: Any physical or virtual location or object, which may be of interest to a user and may serve as a navigation destination (e.g., room, water dispenser, waiting zone, assembly point, shop, seat, etc).

PointOfInterestSegment.Label: Point Of Interest Segement
PointOfInterestSegment.Comment: A traverasal part of a space that is connected to a specific Point of Interest.

Power.Label: Power
Power.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a power unit (such as watt or kilowatt).  Further specializations of the saref:Power class can be found in the SAREF4ENER extension, where classes such as PowerMax, PowerMin and PowerExpected are defined.

subClass.Label: Power Consumption
subClass.Comment: The rate, per unit time, at which energy is consumed.

PowerEquipment.Label: PowerEquipment
PowerEquipment.Comment: Power equipment is the equipment contained in district power system.

PowerUnit.Label: Power unit
PowerUnit.Comment: The unit of measure for power

Pressure.Label: Pressure
Pressure.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a pressure unit (bar or pascal)

PressureUnit.Label: Pressure unit
PressureUnit.Comment: The unit of measure for pressure

Price.Label: Price
Price.Comment: A saref:Property crelated to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured using saref:Currency

Printer.Label: Printer
Printer.Comment: A machine that is connected to a computer and prints onto paper using ink.

Profile.Label: Profile
Profile.Comment: A specification associated to a device to collect information about a certain Property (e.g., Energy) or Commodity (e.g.Water) for optimizing its usage in the home, office or building in which the device is located. This specification is about a certain Property or Commodity (saref:isAbout), can be calculated over a time span (saref:hasTime ) and can be associated to some costs (saref:hasPrice). An example is the Power Profile defined in the SAREF4ENER extension that can be associated to a device for optimizing the Energy efficiency in the home, office or building in which the device is located.

ProfoundHearingImpairedPerson.Label: Profound Hearing Impaired Person
ProfoundHearingImpairedPerson.Comment: A person who cannot hear sounds softer than 90-120 dB. A person suffering from profound hearing loss, using a hearing aid is also ineffective most of the time.

Property.Label: ObservationProperty
Property.Comment: The observed property describes what kind of data is observed.

subClass.Label: Occupancy
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value (saref:hasValue property) that is measured in a unit of measure for occupancy

subClass.Label: Occupancy
subClass.Comment: Usage of a space.

subClass.Label: OccupancyParameter
subClass.Comment: The parameter of occupancy like occupant number or other property

subClass.Label: On Off
subClass.Comment: A property that determines if something is activated (on) or not (off).

subClass.Label: Power
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a power unit (such as watt or kilowatt).  Further specializations of the saref:Power class can be found in the SAREF4ENER extension, where classes such as PowerMax, PowerMin and PowerExpected are defined.

subClass.Label: Power Consumption
subClass.Comment: The amount of power consumed.

subClass.Label: Power Supply
subClass.Comment: Power supplied to a load.

subClass.Label: Pressure
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a pressure unit (bar or pascal)

subClass.Label: Price
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property crelated to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured using saref:Currency

subClass.Label: RSSI
subClass.Comment: Received Signal Strength Indicator

subClass.Label: Smoke
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a unit of measure for smoke

subClass.Label: State of charge
subClass.Comment: A property related to measurements of the battery status of a device. Measured in %. 100 % means fully charged. 0 % no charge.

subClass.Label: Temperature
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a temperature unit (degree_Celsius, degree_Fahrenheit, or degree_kelvin)

subClass.Label: Temperature Setpoint
subClass.Comment: The target value at which a controller attempts to maintain the temperature.

subClass.Label: Time
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property that allows to specify the time concept in terms of instants or intervals according to the imported W3C Time ontology.

subClass.Label: VOC
subClass.Comment: A property that determines the Volatile Organic Compounds (VOC).

subClass.Label: Voltage
subClass.Comment: Voltage in Volts

subClass.Label: Voltage
subClass.Comment: The force of an electric current, measured in volts.

subClass.Label: Volume
subClass.Comment: A property related to measurements measured in volume. Volume is measured in mÂ³.

subClass.Label: Water Consumption
subClass.Comment: The amount of water consumed.

Pump.Label: Pump
Pump.Comment: The pump in HVAC system, DHW system, etc.

Quality.Label: Quality
Quality.Comment: A degree or grade of excellence or worth.

Ramp.Label: Ramp
Ramp.Comment: A sloping surface joining two different levels, as at the entrance or between floors of a building (Oxford Dictionary of English).

RenewableGeneratingUnit.Label: RenewableGeneratingUnit
RenewableGeneratingUnit.Comment: The generating unit produces energy with renewable resources.

subClass.Label: WindGeneratingUnit
subClass.Comment: The generating unit produces energy with wind energy, wind turbines.

Road.Label: Road
Road.Comment: A road is a way on land between two places that has been paved or otherwise improved to allow travel by foot or some form of conveyance, including a motor vehicle, cart, bicycle, or horse.

Role.Label: Role
Role.Comment: The function assumed or part played by a person or thing in a particular situation (Oxford Dictionary of English).

RoleInContext.Label: Role In Context
RoleInContext.Comment: A concept to express that an agent is playing a role in a given context.

Room.Label: Room
Room.Comment: The room contained in the zone

RoomEntrance.Label: Room Entrance
RoomEntrance.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a room.

RoomExit.Label: Room Exit
RoomExit.Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a room.

RoomSegment.Label: Room Segment
RoomSegment.Comment: A traversable part in a room that is usually used to go the exit or the other part of the room.

Route.Label: Route
Route.Comment: A set of connected spaces represented by a starting and ending point, that ultimately leads to some specific position or place.

subClass.Label: Seating Arrangement Route
subClass.Comment: A type of route in which the ending point represents the seat of one or more individuals such as in cinema, stadiums, auditoriums, etc.

subClass.Label: Visit Route
subClass.Comment: A type of route created for visiting purposes within an indoor environment.

RouteElement.Label: Route Element
RouteElement.Comment: It represents the physical or conceptual elements of a navigation path.

subClass.Label: Route Point
subClass.Comment: Any spatial element that is part of a path and traversable by persons. In addition, it may be used as a logic representation of physical passages to represent a node (or a vertex) in a route graph.

RoutePoint.Label: Route Point
RoutePoint.Comment: Any spatial element that is part of a path and traversable by persons. In addition, it may be used as a logic representation of physical passages to represent a node (or a vertex) in a route graph.

subClass.Label: Transition Point
subClass.Comment: A point at which person passes from one place to the next.

subClass.Label: Waiting Zone
subClass.Comment: A space (normally with seating), where people can wait to do some specific activity. During emergency condtions, it is also used for several purposes, such as unification of people with their family members, acquaintances or emergency rescue teams, etc.

Schedule.Label: Schedule
Schedule.Comment: The day schedule of the event taken place in the zone

SeatingArrangementRoute.Label: Seating Arrangement Route
SeatingArrangementRoute.Comment: A type of route in which the ending point represents the seat of one or more individuals such as in cinema, stadiums, auditoriums, etc.

SensingFunction.Label: Sensing function
SensingFunction.Comment: A function that allows to transmit data from sensors, such as measurement values (e.g., temperature) or sensing data (e.g., occupancy)

Sensor.Label: Sensor
Sensor.Comment: A device that detects and responds to events or changes in the physical environment such as light, motion, or temperature changes. Further, a device of category saref:Sensor that performs a saref:SensingFunction.

subClass.Label: Smoke sensor
subClass.Comment: A device that consists of a sensor, has category saref:Sensor, performs the saref:SensingFunction and saref:EventFunction (which notifies that a certain threshold has been exceeded), and is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Smoke.

subClass.Label: Temperature sensor
subClass.Comment: A device that consists of a sensor, has category saref:Sensor, performs the saref:SensingFunction and is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Temperature

SensorEvent.Label: Sensor Event
SensorEvent.Comment: This concept is used to express an event detected by any sensor.

SensoryAbility.Label: Sensor Ability
SensoryAbility.Comment: Sensory ability is referred to the brain's ability to receive, interpret, and effectively use the information provided by the senses in human beings such as touch, hear, smell, vision, etc.

SensoryImpairedPerson.Label: Sensory Impairmed Person
SensoryImpairedPerson.Comment: Sensory impairment is when one of the senses such as sight, hearing, smell, touch, taste and spatial awareness, is no longer normal.

subClass.Label: Visually Impaired Person
subClass.Comment: It is a partial or total unability to see. It is also known as visual loss. Here, we considered a person having visual impairment who as severe low vision; 20/200 to 20/400 or higher.

Service.Label: Service
Service.Comment: A service is a representation of a function to a network that makes the function discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A service can represent one or more functions. A Service is offered by a device that wants (a certain set of) its function(s) to be discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A Service must specify the device that is offering the service and the function(s) to be represented.

subClass.Label: Switch on service
subClass.Comment: A type of service that represents an on/off function to the network

SetAbsoluteLevelCommand.Label: Set absolute level command
SetAbsoluteLevelCommand.Comment: A type of set level command

subClass.Label: Set relative level command
subClass.Comment: A type of set level command

SetRelativeLevelCommand.Label: Set relative level command
SetRelativeLevelCommand.Comment: A type of set level command

SevereHearingImpairedPerson.Label: Severe Hearing Impaired Person
SevereHearingImpairedPerson.Comment: A person who is unable to hear anything without wearing a hearing aid.

Severity.Label: Severity
Severity.Comment: The quality of being hard to endure, uninviting or formidable.

ShoppingMallBuilding.Label: Shopping Mall Building
ShoppingMallBuilding.Comment: A set of one or more buildings forming a complex of shops representing merchandisers, with interconnecting walkways enabling visitors to easily walk from unit to unit, along with a parking area.

ShoppingRoute.Label: Shopping Route
ShoppingRoute.Comment: A type of route in which the specific points of interest are mentioned in the form of connected spaces, according to the preferences or interests of a one or more individuals.

Slot.Label: Slot
Slot.Comment: A slot in an ordered list with a fixed index.

SmartPhone.Label: Smartphone
SmartPhone.Comment: A mobile phone that is able to perform many of the functions of a computer, typically having a relatively large screen and an operating system capable of running general-purpose applications (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Smoke.Label: Smoke
Smoke.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a unit of measure for smoke

SmokeSensor.Label: Smoke sensor
SmokeSensor.Comment: A device that consists of a sensor, has category saref:Sensor, performs the saref:SensingFunction and saref:EventFunction (which notifies that a certain threshold has been exceeded), and is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Smoke.

SocialUnit.Label: Social Unit
SocialUnit.Comment: An individual, or a group or community, considered as a discrete constituent of a society or larger group (Oxford Dictionary of English).

SolarIrradiance.Label: SolarIrradiance
SolarIrradiance.Comment: The intensity of outdoor solar radiation

Space.Label: Space
Space.Comment: A physical, three dimensional, and one of the most important elements in the design of architecture that can further be divided to create more spaces from it.

subClass.Label: Thoroughfare
subClass.Comment: A road or path forming a route between two places (Oxford Dictionary of English).

SpaceSafety.Label: Space Saftey
SpaceSafety.Comment: A parameter to express the safety of any space for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of some value.

SpatialAbility.Label: Spatial Ability
SpatialAbility.Comment: This ability expresses the capacity to understand, reason and remember the spatial relations among objects and spaces.

StadiumBuilding.Label: Stadium Building
StadiumBuilding.Comment: A building that has a large open area surrounded by many rows of seats, and  used for sports events, concerts, etc.

Stakeholder.Label: Stakeholder
Stakeholder.Comment: The stakeholder in district or building that has performance goals to be achieved

Stampeding.Label: Stampeding
Stampeding.Comment: A sudden and uncontrollable run by the group of people caused by panic.

StartState.Label: Start state
StartState.Comment: The state of a device that is STARTED

StartStopFunction.Label: Start stop function
StartStopFunction.Comment: An actuating function that allows to start and stop a device

subClass.Label: Stop state
subClass.Comment: The state of a device that is STOPPED

State.Label: State
State.Comment: The state in which a device can be found, e.g, ON/OFF/STANDBY, or ONLINE/OFFLINE. We propose here a list of states that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

StopState.Label: Stop state
StopState.Comment: The state of a device that is STOPPED

Storage.Label: Storage
Storage.Comment: A type of energy-related device that stores energy

StoringUnit.Label: StoringUnit
StoringUnit.Comment: Storing unit is the device that stores energy.

StoveOven.Label: Stove Oven
StoveOven.Comment: A piece of equipment that burns fuel or uses electricity in order to heat a place.

StrategicKPI.Label: StrategicKPI
StrategicKPI.Comment: The strategic KPI is the KPI at the strategic decision level, the hyper-aggregated KPI corresponding to district scale

Substation.Label: Substation
Substation.Comment: Substation is where transform the high/medio voltage power from main grid to low voltage for the energy use of district consumers.

Suite.Label: Suite
Suite.Comment: A suite of rooms usually on one floor of an apartmentÂ house (Cambridge English Dictionary). This term is normally used in hotels, resorts, guesthouses, etc.

Switch.Label: Switch
Switch.Comment: A device of category saref:Actuator that performs an actuating function of type saref:OnOffFunction or saref:OpenCloseFunction

SwitchOnService.Label: Switch on service
SwitchOnService.Comment: A type of service that represents an on/off function to the network

TV.Label: TV
TV.Comment: A device shaped like a box with a screen that receives electrical signals and changes them into moving images and sound, or the method or business of sending images and sound by electrical signals.

TacticalKPI.Label: TacticalKPI
TacticalKPI.Comment: The tactical KPI is the KPI at tactical decision level, the KPI disaggregated from strategic KPI corresponding to building and system level

Task.Label: Task
Task.Comment: The goal for which a device is designed (from a user perspective). For example, a washing machine is designed for the task of washing. We propose here a list of tasks that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

Telephone.Label: Telephone
Telephone.Comment: A device for transmitting voices over a distance using wire or radio, by converting acoustic vibrations to electrical signals (Oxford Dictionary of English).

TemperatureSensor.Label: Temperature sensor
TemperatureSensor.Comment: A device that consists of a sensor, has category saref:Sensor, performs the saref:SensingFunction and is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Temperature

TemperatureSetpoint.Label: Temperature Setpoint
TemperatureSetpoint.Comment: The target value at which a controller attempts to maintain the temperature.

TemperatureUnit.Label: Temperature unit
TemperatureUnit.Comment: The unit of measure for temperature

TemporalEntity.Label: TemporalEntity
TemporalEntity.Comment: A temporal entity is an instant or an interval

TerroristAttack.Label: Terrorist Attack
TerroristAttack.Comment: A surprise event involving the deliberate use of violence against the occupants of the buildings.

TextualDescription.Label: Textual Description
TextualDescription.Comment: A type of description in which only text or writings are used to provide the information about any entity.

ThermalComfort.Label: ThermalComfort
ThermalComfort.Comment: Thermal comfort describes the comfort condition related indoor temperature and humidity

ThermoSolarSystem.Label: Thermo Solar System
ThermoSolarSystem.Comment: A power system designed to supply thermal energy by means of solar energy.

Thoroughfare.Label: Thoroughfare
Thoroughfare.Comment: A road or path forming a route between two places (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Time.Label: Time
Time.Comment: A saref:Property that allows to specify the time concept in terms of instants or intervals according to the imported W3C Time ontology.

TransitionPoint.Label: Transition Point
TransitionPoint.Comment: A point at which person passes from one place to the next.

TravelTime.Label: Travel Time
TravelTime.Comment: A parameter to express the time taken (in seconds) by a specific person (or type of persons) to go from one point to another point (i.e., Route Element).

TumbleDryer.Label: Tumble Dryer
TumbleDryer.Comment: A machine that dries washed clothes by spinning them in hot air inside a rotating drum.

TurnPoint.Label: Turn Point
TurnPoint.Comment: A logic point that is used to enforce people to change their direction.

U-value.Label: U-value
U-value.Comment: Overall thermal conductance of the envelope

UniversalConstant.Label: UniversalConstant
UniversalConstant.Comment: The universal constant in the mathematical model of KPI calculation

VOC.Label: VOC
VOC.Comment: A property that determines the Volatile Organic Compounds (VOC).

VerticalMovingPavement.Label: Vertical Moving Pavement
VerticalMovingPavement.Comment: A slow-moving conveyor mechanism that transports people across an inclined plane over a short to medium distance.

VerticalPassage.Label: Vertical Passage
VerticalPassage.Comment: A type of passage that connects spatial elements located on different storey or floor.

Visit.Label: Visit
Visit.Comment: An activity that represents an act of going to see a person or place as a guest, tourist or a spectator. Normally, this type of activity is considered as a leasiure or recreational activity.

VisitRoute.Label: Visit Route
VisitRoute.Comment: A type of route created for visiting purposes within an indoor environment.

VisitingGroup.Label: Visiting Group
VisitingGroup.Comment: A group of two or more people that has the same objective of visiting any space.

VisualComfort.Label: VisualComfort
VisualComfort.Comment: The visual comfort describes the comfort related to light condition

VisuallyImpairedPerson.Label: Visually Impaired Person
VisuallyImpairedPerson.Comment: It is a partial or total unability to see. It is also known as visual loss. Here, we considered a person having visual impairment who as severe low vision; 20/200 to 20/400 or higher.

Voltage.Label: Voltage
Voltage.Comment: The force of an electric current, measured in volts.

Volume.Label: Volume
Volume.Comment: Specifies the volume of the air conditioned space in building

WaitingZone.Label: Waiting Zone
WaitingZone.Comment: A space (normally with seating), where people can wait to do some specific activity. During emergency condtions, it is also used for several purposes, such as unification of people with their family members, acquaintances or emergency rescue teams, etc.

WashingMachine.Label: Washing Machine
WashingMachine.Comment: A home appliance for washing clothes and linens automatically.

subClass.Label: WeatherCondition
subClass.Comment: The weather condition describes the weather such as rain, sun, snow, etc.

subClass.Label: WeatherPhenomenon
subClass.Comment: Weather phenomenon describes the ourdoor temperature, humidity, solar radiation and wind.

WeatherCondition.Label: WeatherCondition
WeatherCondition.Comment: The weather condition describes the weather such as rain, sun, snow, etc.

WeatherForecast.Label: WeatherForecast
WeatherForecast.Comment: The short-term forecast of the weather

WeatherForecastingService.Label: Weather Forecasting Service
WeatherForecastingService.Comment: Represents a service that provides weather forecast to specific locations.

WeatherPhenomenon.Label: WeatherPhenomenon
WeatherPhenomenon.Comment: Weather phenomenon describes the ourdoor temperature, humidity, solar radiation and wind.

subClass.Label: Wind
subClass.Comment: The wind condition like wind speed and wind direction

subClass.Label: WindDirection
subClass.Comment: The weather phenomenon of wind direction

subClass.Label: WindSpeed
subClass.Comment: The weather phenomenon of wind speed

Wind.Label: Wind
Wind.Comment: The wind condition like wind speed and wind direction

WindDirection.Label: WindDirection
WindDirection.Comment: The weather phenomenon of wind direction

WindGeneratingUnit.Label: WindGeneratingUnit
WindGeneratingUnit.Comment: The generating unit produces energy with wind energy, wind turbines.

WindPowerSystem.Label: WindPowerSystem
WindPowerSystem.Comment: System that generates electricity through wind power

WindSpeed.Label: WindSpeed
WindSpeed.Comment: The weather phenomenon of wind speed

http://identifiers.org/mamo/Mathematical.Label: Mathematical_model
http://identifiers.org/mamo/Mathematical.Comment: The mathematical model for KPI calculation. The model is composed of a set of variables and a set of equations that establish relationships between the variables.

http://identifiers.org/mamo/Variable.Label: Variable
http://identifiers.org/mamo/Variable.Comment: The variable in the mathematical model of KPI calculation

http://purl.org/dc/terms/Location.Label: Location
http://purl.org/dc/terms/Location.Comment: A spatial region or named place. It contains the geographical coordinates point or postal address of an object.

http://schema.org/Event.Label: Event
http://schema.org/Event.Comment: The event taken place in the zone, such entertainment event, dinner, conference, etc. A non-persistent, time-based occurrence, has location, duration, and responsible actors associated with an event.

http://www.w3.org/ns/sosa/ObservableProp.Label: Observable Property
http://www.w3.org/ns/sosa/ObservableProp.Comment: An observable quality (property, characteristic) of a FeatureOfInterest.

http://www.w3.org/ns/sosa/Observation.Label: Observation
http://www.w3.org/ns/sosa/Observation.Comment: Act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of a property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to an ObservableProperty to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to a FeatureOfInterest to detail what that property was associated with.

http://www.w3.org/ns/sosa/Sensor.Label: Sensor
http://www.w3.org/ns/sosa/Sensor.Comment: Device, agent (including humans), or software (simulation) involved in, or implementing, a Procedure.
